content:
• Wednesday, October 26, 2011

  • Risk assets are on the move higher on word of the deal for a Greek bond haircut. Euro +0.5% at...

    Risk assets are on the move higher on word of the deal for a Greek bond haircut. Euro +0.5% at $1.3976. Hong Kong +1.4%. S&P 500 futures +0.9%, German DAX futures +0.7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:06 PM
  • LMT

    Lockheed (LMT -3.2%) faces a new funding challenge in the troubled F-35 Joint Strike Fighter...

    Lockheed (LMT -3.2%) faces a new funding challenge in the troubled F-35 Joint Strike Fighter program, as the Pentagon asks suppliers to take on more risk by tying additional funding to paying for the cost of additional work discovered during aircraft testing. CEO Bob Stevens says the change could stifle technological innovation in the defense industry.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • EQIX

    Data center owner Equinix (NASDAQ:EQIX) falls 5.1% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $417.6M...

    Data center owner Equinix (NASDAQ:EQIX) falls 5.1% AH after reporting Q3 revenue of $417.6M (+26% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.21; the former beat by $1.4M, but the latter missed by $0.33. Operating cash flow grew 1% Y/Y to $141.8M, while capex was a hefty $130.5M. Equinix expects 2011 and 2012 revenues to be above consensus figures of $1.6B and $1.87B, respectively.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:31 PM
  • SIMG

    Silicon Image (SIMG -8.7%) dived today after reporting Q3 results. While revenue of $59.7M (+11%...

    Silicon Image (SIMG -8.7%) dived today after reporting Q3 results. While revenue of $59.7M (+11% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.06 beat consensus by $0.7M and $0.02, the company's forecast of a slight Q4 revenue decline (guidance range of $57M-$59M) didn't go over well. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:15 PM
  • SOA

    More on Solutia's (NYSE:SOA) Q3 report: Expects net sales in Q4 in-line with Q3 results as...

    More on Solutia's (NYSE:SOA) Q3 report: Expects net sales in Q4 in-line with Q3 results as slightly higher volumes are expected to be substantially offset by the translation impact from a stronger U.S. dollar. Full-year net sales forecast to be in $2.05B-$2.1B range, and EPS of $2.00 vs. prior guidance of $1.95-$2.05. Shares +8.8% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • NSC

    More on Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC): Q3 beats across the board. Earnings jump 18% Y/Y on...

    More on Norfolk Southern (NYSE:NSC): Q3 beats across the board. Earnings jump 18% Y/Y on double-digit revenue growth across all segments, with particular strength coming from its coal operations. Shares +3.9% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:04 PM | 1 Comment
  • ACOM

    More on Ancestry.com's (NASDAQ:ACOM) Q3: Subscribers totaled 1.7M, up 24% Y/Y but only 2% Q/Q....

    More on Ancestry.com's (NASDAQ:ACOM) Q3: Subscribers totaled 1.7M, up 24% Y/Y but only 2% Q/Q. In addition, the company expects to close Q4 with just 1.685M-1.695M subscribers, down from prior guidance and confirming fears of slowing growth. Q4 revenue of $103M-$105M is forecast, compared with a $104.7M consensus. ACOM -8.3% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 5:01 PM
  • SKX

    Skechers (NYSE:SKX) Q3 EPS beat estimates on a research tax benefit, but overall results lag on...

    Skechers (NYSE:SKX) Q3 EPS beat estimates on a research tax benefit, but overall results lag on a Y/Y basis. Sales were down 25% Y/Y, primarily due to a decline in higher priced toning footwear, plus lower than expected sales across other footwear lines as well. Shares +5.9% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:53 PM
  • QRVO

    More on TriQuint's (TQNT) Q3 report: Gross margin was 34.9%, down 540 bps Q/Q. The company...

    More on TriQuint's (TQNT) Q3 report: Gross margin was 34.9%, down 540 bps Q/Q. The company expects Q4 revenue of $215M-$225M and EPS of $0.06-$0.08, below a consensus of $230.7M and $0.14. Gross margin is expected to decline further, to 32%-34%. TQNT now -13.5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM
  • AKAM

    Already on the move after beating earnings, Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) soars after guiding higher for...

    Already on the move after beating earnings, Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM) soars after guiding higher for Q4 on its conference call. The company sees earnings of $0.37-0.41 vs. consensus of $0.39, and sales of $303-$315M vs. consensus of $310M. Shares +12% AH.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • BMC

    More on BMC Software's (NASDAQ:BMC) FQ2: FY12 EPS guidance represents a slight drop from July...

    More on BMC Software's (NASDAQ:BMC) FQ2: FY12 EPS guidance represents a slight drop from July levels. Total bookings fell 16% Y/Y, in stark contrast to FQ1's 39% increase. The decline was due to weakness in BMC's server management software business (ESM). BMC was hit earlier this month by reports of an ESM sales exec leaving. BMC -5% AH. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM
  • CA

    More from CA's FQ2 report: The company "achieved our objectives" in EPS, cash and margin but "We...

    More from CA's FQ2 report: The company "achieved our objectives" in EPS, cash and margin but "We were not pleased with one area, new product sales." Revised revenue growth expectations for fiscal 2012 down to 5-6% from 6-8%, vs. a consensus of 9.3%. Expects full-year EPS of $2.13-$2.18, vs. expected $2.17. CA -2.4% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:28 PM
  • CA

    CA Inc. (NASDAQ:CA): FQ2 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.2B (+10% Y/Y) in-line....

    CA Inc. (NASDAQ:CA): FQ2 EPS of $0.51 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.2B (+10% Y/Y) in-line. Results include $0.06 impact from previously announced layoffs. Cash flow from operations up 37% to $190M. Shares -2.4% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • BMC

    BMC Software (NASDAQ:BMC): FQ1 EPS of $0.87 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $556.7M (+10% Y/Y) beats...

    BMC Software (NASDAQ:BMC): FQ1 EPS of $0.87 beats by $0.06. Revenue of $556.7M (+10% Y/Y) beats by $16.3M. Expects FY12 EPS of $3.21-$3.31 vs. $3.29 consensus. BMC -1.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • AKAM

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM): Q3 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $281.9M (+11% Y/Y) beats by...

    Akamai (NASDAQ:AKAM): Q3 EPS of $0.34 beats by $0.01. Revenue of $281.9M (+11% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares +4.3% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:07 PM
  • KWR

    Specialty chemical maker Quaker Chemical (KWR +12%) closes near its highs after its Q3 results...

    Specialty chemical maker Quaker Chemical (KWR +12%) closes near its highs after its Q3 results handily topped analysts' estimates earlier today. Revenue and gross margins both showed solid improvement, despite softening demand in some of its key markets due to price increases.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • SAP

    SAP (SAP +2.3%) gains following its Q3 report, as the company boasts it's "growing 10 percentage...

    SAP (SAP +2.3%) gains following its Q3 report, as the company boasts it's "growing 10 percentage points faster" than archrival Oracle (NYSE:ORCL). SAP claims sales of its flagship ERP software rose 26% Y/Y, while analytics software sales rose 35%. In addition, SAP is reporting an $829M annual sales pipeline for its popular Hana high-performance database.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • DGII

    Digi International (DGII -8.8%) says the operation of a contract manufacturer it uses near...

    Digi International (DGII -8.8%) says the operation of a contract manufacturer it uses near Bangkok has been significantly impacted due to flooding, and that all operations in Thailand that service Digi are suspended. Digi says it is assessing its ability to meet customer requirements via other means, but it believes FQ1 revenue and margins will be hurt.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:40 PM
  • POL

    PolyOne (POL -3.5%) gets hit after Wells Fargo lowers the shares to Market Perform from...

    PolyOne (POL -3.5%) gets hit after Wells Fargo lowers the shares to Market Perform from Outperform, saying the stock has limited near-term upside after its weaker than expected Q3 results.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:39 PM
  • DPS-OLD

    Shares of Dr Pepper Snapple (DPS-OLD -4.4%) lose ground after the company's Q3 report highlights...

    Shares of Dr Pepper Snapple (DPS-OLD -4.4%) lose ground after the company's Q3 report highlights soft sales due to price increases instituted on juices such as Hawaiian Punch and Mott's. The company affirms full-year guidance even with costs now slotted at the high end of their range.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM
  • SODA

    Deutsche Bank is coming to Sodastream (SODA -8.2%) defense, as the arrival of new competition...

    Deutsche Bank is coming to Sodastream (SODA -8.2%) defense, as the arrival of new competition from Primo Water (PRMW +7.2%) pummels shares. Deutsche believes there's currently room for just one player in the home soda machine market, and Sodastream's offerings are "reasonably entrenched."

     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM | 3 Comments
  • MG

    Mistras (MG -3.9%) dips after KeyBanc downgrades the shares to Neutral on valuation. The firm...

    Mistras (MG -3.9%) dips after KeyBanc downgrades the shares to Neutral on valuation. The firm still sees long-term growth potential, but over the near-term says the stock is fairly valued. The stock has been on a steady tear, having doubled in value over the past year.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:27 PM
  • MTW

    Manitowoc (NYSE:MTW) powers through a 21.5% gain after a well-received Q3 report set the stage....

    Manitowoc (NYSE:MTW) powers through a 21.5% gain after a well-received Q3 report set the stage. CEO Glen Tellock keeps the good vibrations going in a CC, saying 2011 was only a "transition" year - while 2012 will see the impact of growing global markets hit the company's top-line result.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:22 PM
  • EV

    Money manager Eaton Vance (EV +3.1%) has authorized the repurchase of 8M shares. The buyback,...

    Money manager Eaton Vance (EV +3.1%) has authorized the repurchase of 8M shares. The buyback, worth nearly $200M at current prices, replaces an 3.8M plan authorized in July.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 PM
  • RRM

    RRSat Global (RRST -5.7%) dips after Oppenheimer cut the shares to Perform from Outperform,...

    RRSat Global (RRST -5.7%) dips after Oppenheimer cut the shares to Perform from Outperform, citing concerns that the macroeconomic environment will limit the company's backlog growth over the near-term.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:11 PM
  • BAYRY

    Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY +1.6%) trades higher today after saying their cancer-fighting regorafenib...

    Bayer (OTCPK:BAYRY +1.6%) trades higher today after saying their cancer-fighting regorafenib compound - produced jointly with Onyx Pharmaceuticals (ONXX +9.8%) - met the primary endpoint of a late-stage trial in metastatic colorectal-cancer patients.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • ALR

    Medical diagnostic equipment firms Alere (ALR +14.8%) and Quidel (QDEL +12.4%) are taking off...

    Medical diagnostic equipment firms Alere (ALR +14.8%) and Quidel (QDEL +12.4%) are taking off after each posted their Q3 results. Alere's Q3 EPS beat Street estimates by $0.08 on 9% Y/Y revenue growth. Quidel's Q3 EPS missed by $0.05, but its revenue beat estimates by $2.8M, on the back of 17% Y/Y growth. (QDEL transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 2:42 PM
  • WYN

    Wyndham Worldwide (WYN +3.5%) is trading higher after its Q3 EPS beat estimates this morning....

    Wyndham Worldwide (WYN +3.5%) is trading higher after its Q3 EPS beat estimates this morning. Earnings improved 12% on increased rental revenue and lodging sales growth. The company also raises FY11 guidance, now expecting earnings of around $2.41 - $2.45 per share, up from its prior target of $2.32 - $2.40.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR +20%) soars after its Q3 blew away estimates late yesterday....

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR +20%) soars after its Q3 blew away estimates late yesterday. Profit jumped 98% on significantly higher shipments of its multiple-sclerosis treatment Acthar. The company says it posted a 174% Y/Y increase in paid prescriptions for the drug during the quarter, and a 54% increase in overall vial shipments.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:23 PM
  • IDCC

    DealReporter stories (I, II) continue to yank InterDigital (IDCC -5.8%) around. Shares have...

    DealReporter stories (I, II) continue to yank InterDigital (IDCC -5.8%) around. Shares have dived in afternoon trading following a report about potential buyers being in a "holding pattern." It's been over 3 months since InterDigital put itself on sale, during which time nearly every tech firm with use for a wireless patent has been linked to buyout talks (I, II).
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • FSLR

    First Solar's (NASDAQ:FSLR) Q4 guidance cuts are ugly, but "the shares got hammered yesterday on...

    First Solar's (NASDAQ:FSLR) Q4 guidance cuts are ugly, but "the shares got hammered yesterday on fears that there was something bigger going on," Raymond James analyst Alex Morris says on the appointment of founder Michael Ahearn to replace Rob Gillette as CEO. "Ahearn allayed market fears that there was some sort of scandal." FSLR +9%, paring earlier gains.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:53 PM | 1 Comment
  • TUP

    Tupperware (TUP +1.8%) trades up after reporting an in-line Q3, but a better than expected...

    Tupperware (TUP +1.8%) trades up after reporting an in-line Q3, but a better than expected bottom line due to strong sales growth in its Asia Pacific markets. However, the company lowers its FY11 forecast, now saying its EPS will be in the range of $4.45 - $4.50 per share, versus July's outlook for $4.50 - $4.60 per share.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:52 PM
  • AB

    AllianceBernstein (AB -2.7%) Q3 EPS beat estimates on a sharp increase in operating margins, but...

    AllianceBernstein (AB -2.7%) Q3 EPS beat estimates on a sharp increase in operating margins, but revenue came in light as assets under management declined due to ongoing uncertainty in the global markets. For the third quarter, total net outflows were $15B on a total AUM of $402B, down 13% from Q2 and 16% Y/Y.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:39 PM

  • Stocks and the euro are sprinting higher on an AP report that China will invest in the EU...

    Stocks and the euro are sprinting higher on an AP report that China will invest in the EU bailout fund. Haven't we already tried that one? An earlier story had the head of the EFSF on his way to China with his hand out.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:38 PM | 13 Comments
  • S

    After rising premarket on its Q3 report (I, II), Sprint (S -4.8%) is now selling off, as weak...

    After rising premarket on its Q3 report (I, II), Sprint (S -4.8%) is now selling off, as weak cash flow guidance and concerns about iPhone (NASDAQ:AAPL) purchase commitments ding shares. Morgan Keegan's Tavis McCourt estimates Sprint, which currently sells ~15M smartphones/year, is on the hook to buy 25M-30M iPhones over the next 4 years. (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM
  • OPEN

    The "MoMo Massacre" resembles a classic slasher pic, writes Kid Dynamite, where the characters...

    The "MoMo Massacre" resembles a classic slasher pic, writes Kid Dynamite, where the characters get killed off one by one. Starting with OPEN and RIMM, continuing through to GMCR, FSLR, and NFLX, and now AMZN. We know how the sequels go, so those remaining - AAPL, CMG, PCLN - don't go outside to check on that odd noise.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 12 Comments
  • TDY

    LeCroy (LCRY +15.4%), a maker of electronics testing gear, surges after reporting FQ1 revenue of...

    LeCroy (LCRY +15.4%), a maker of electronics testing gear, surges after reporting FQ1 revenue of $49M (+25% Y/Y) and EPS of $0.26, beating consensus by $1.5M and $0.01. The company now expects FY12 revenue of $200M-$205M and EPS of $1.16-$1.21, compared with a consensus of $199.5M and $1.17.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:21 PM
  • ATI

    Allegheny Technologies (ATI +4.8%) jumps after its Q3 beats EPS estimates. Revenue rose 28% Y/Y...

    Allegheny Technologies (ATI +4.8%) jumps after its Q3 beats EPS estimates. Revenue rose 28% Y/Y on better than expected sales of high performance metals, and the company's ability to pass off rising steel costs through higher product prices. The company lowers its FY11 revenue guidance however, citing a slowdown in orders due to the recent economic turmoil. It now expect to earn $5.2B, down from its July estimate of between $5.4B - $5.5B.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM
  • PNRA

    Panera (NASDAQ:PNRA) rockets up 14.4% after nailing a Q3 earnings triple play and grabbing lofty...

    Panera (NASDAQ:PNRA) rockets up 14.4% after nailing a Q3 earnings triple play and grabbing lofty price target increases from Oppenheimer and Piper Jaffray to $150 and $156, respectively. CEO Bill Moreton says in a CC that the firm's MyPanera rewards program has been a runaway success with 8M registered users. "This is a tremendously powerful tool for us that we're just scratching the surface with."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM
  • CRM

    For some reason, this guy can move markets. Salesforce.com (CRM -4.8%) slides after Whitney...

    For some reason, this guy can move markets. Salesforce.com (CRM -4.8%) slides after Whitney Tilson tells CNBC he's short the stock in size. Valuation is the key reason he says, arguing the stock could drop 75%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 6 Comments
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) trades 9.5% lower on volume already 2X daily activity....

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) trades 9.5% lower on volume already 2X daily activity. Forbes reports 83% of analysts are still locked in on GMCR as a Buy, even in the face of Einhorn's strafing run at the stock.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:50 PM | 1 Comment
  • AVY

    Avery Dennison's (AVY -5.02%) takes a hit after its Q3 earnings missed the mark, primarily due...

    Avery Dennison's (AVY -5.02%) takes a hit after its Q3 earnings missed the mark, primarily due to weak demand in its retail branding segment. The company says it expects the negative trend to continue, and lowers its FY11 forecast. It now expects to earn between $2.15 - $2.30 per share, below its July projection of $2.45 - $2.75 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • PVTB

    Shares of PrivateBancorp (PVTB +5.4%) see a bounce after JPMorgan lines up a new price target of...

    Shares of PrivateBancorp (PVTB +5.4%) see a bounce after JPMorgan lines up a new price target of $13 on shares. It's already been a big week for PrivateBancorp, up 23%, after the bank holding company reported Q3 revenue more than doubled from last year's haul.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:42 PM
  • WBA

    An agreement to settle the dispute that would keep Walgreen (WAG -3.7%) stores in the Express...

    An agreement to settle the dispute that would keep Walgreen (WAG -3.7%) stores in the Express Scripts (ESRX -12.9%) network would be "better for everyone," ESRX head George Paz says during a conference call after its earnings report, but "it looks less and less likely that's going to occur." Paz says his company has strong client support to move ahead without an agreement.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:14 PM
  • AGN

    Allergan (AGN -3.5%) dips after its Q3 swung to a profit on strong specialty pharmaceutical...

    Allergan (AGN -3.5%) dips after its Q3 swung to a profit on strong specialty pharmaceutical sales, but the company's issues cautious Q4 guidance below Street estimates. It now forecasts current-quarter earnings of between $0.97 - $0.99 per share on sales of $1.33B to $1.41B, below analysts expectations for an EPS of $1.01 on revenue of $1.41B.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM
  • AMZN

    Amazon's (AMZN -11.8%) soft Q3 report (I, II) is taking a toll on rivals eBay (EBAY -2.2%),...

    Amazon's (AMZN -11.8%) soft Q3 report (I, II) is taking a toll on rivals eBay (EBAY -2.2%), Barnes & Noble (BKS -2.2%), and Overstock.com (OSTK -1.7%). In B&N's case, Amazon's remarks about boosting Kindle Fire production could also be a factor. (more) (transcript)

     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM
  • MFGLQ

    If Jon Corzine gets booted from the CEO chair in any MF Global (MF -26.6%) takeover, his...

    If Jon Corzine gets booted from the CEO chair in any MF Global (MF -26.6%) takeover, his reputation may take a hit but not his wallet. MF Global this spring estimated Corzine could collect ~$12.1M in severance pay, pro-rated bonus and other benefits if he loses his job in connection with a takeover.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • ANAD

    Anadigics (ANAD +15.5%), a maker of mobile phone power amplifiers, rallies strongly after...

    Anadigics (ANAD +15.5%), a maker of mobile phone power amplifiers, rallies strongly after posting Q3 revenue of $37.3M (-39% Y/Y) and EPS of -$0.12, beating consensus by $1.4M and $0.03. Anadigics has been bleeding share, as Sprint (NYSE:S) and Verizon's (NYSE:VZ) rollout of 4G networks leads to declining shipments of the company's 3G EV-DO amplifiers.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM
  • ARW

    Arrow Electronics (ARW +7.5%) Q3 misses on all counts, but the stock is trading higher after the...

    Arrow Electronics (ARW +7.5%) Q3 misses on all counts, but the stock is trading higher after the company posts better overall metrics from its enterprise-computing business and ups its FY11 EPS forecast above analysts' projections. It now see its EPS coming in around $1.25 - $1.37 per share, versus analysts' expectations of $1.25 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM
  • AMZN

    Amazon (AMZN -11.5%) would seem to be the latest victim of the Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) machine, with...

    Amazon (AMZN -11.5%) would seem to be the latest victim of the Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) machine, with Q3’s 42% EPS miss expected to be followed by Q4 losses on the Kindle Fire alone of as much as $200M, as it subsidizes the Fire anywhere from $10 to $100. But AMZN has no choice: "The traditional media business they have would wilt on the vine without [the] transition to digital."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 1 Comment
  • FSLR

    First Solar (FSLR +14%) recoups a large chunk of yesterday's losses after delivering Q3 results...

    First Solar (FSLR +14%) recoups a large chunk of yesterday's losses after delivering Q3 results (I, II) ahead of schedule this morning. Jefferies suspects the company's ugly Q4 guidance was the reason for Rob Gillette's removal, but adds the report is still a positive for investors who feared accounting or fraud issues were the culprit.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM
  • BMS

    Food and beverage company Bemis (BMS -9.9%) is trading lower after missing Q3 estimates this...

    Food and beverage company Bemis (BMS -9.9%) is trading lower after missing Q3 estimates this morning. Earnings dipped 9.1% as weak demand pushed unit volume lower across all its product lines. The company also notes the weak trend is continuing into its current quarter as well, and cuts Q4 guidance. It now sees its EPS around $0.36 - $0.42 per share, below analysts' estimates of $0.55 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:31 AM
  • WBSN

    Shares of Websense (WBSN -10.7%) fall sharply despite knocking out a Q3 earnings beat, $0.44 vs....

    Shares of Websense (WBSN -10.7%) fall sharply despite knocking out a Q3 earnings beat, $0.44 vs. $0.41 consensus. Investors appear to be honing in on the firm's full-year guidance pointing to lower total billings for its web security services than previously forecast.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • SODA

    Home soda machine maker Sodastream (SODA -6.3%) is selling off on strong volume. Herb Greenberg...

    Home soda machine maker Sodastream (SODA -6.3%) is selling off on strong volume. Herb Greenberg claims the decline is due to Primo Water's (PRMW +2.2%) introduction of a rival product - no PR has been issued, but a website for Primo's soda machine is up.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:20 AM | 5 Comments
  • ABAX

    Medical products supplier Abaxis (ABAX +16%) pops after its FQ2 easily beats estimates. Revenues...

    Medical products supplier Abaxis (ABAX +16%) pops after its FQ2 easily beats estimates. Revenues rose 13% Y/Y on a jump in veterinary product and medical instrument sales, plus solid growth in its European and Asian markets. Separately, the company also approves $40M stock buyback program.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:15 AM
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +2.3%) gains after Nomura's Aaron Jeng starts the chipmaker at Buy, with a $31...

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +2.3%) gains after Nomura's Aaron Jeng starts the chipmaker at Buy, with a $31 PT. Jeng sees Spreadtrum as a play on China's 3G growth, given its leading position in the TD-SCDMA chip market, and notes shares trade at a significant discount to those of Taiwanese rival MediaTek.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM
  • ATGE

    Shares of DeVry (DV), rattled with a rocky FQ1 report, look to get a lift after Oppenheimer...

    Shares of DeVry (DV), rattled with a rocky FQ1 report, look to get a lift after Oppenheimer reiterates its Outperform rating noting "positive growth in enrollment occurred at all currently reporting segments." Analysts with the firm clipped their PT on shares to $57 from $70, still repping 46% upside potential. Shares are down 14.9% on the day.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • KONA

    Shares of Kona Grill (NASDAQ:KONA) fall off 12.2% after the company beats EPS estimates by a...

    Shares of Kona Grill (NASDAQ:KONA) fall off 12.2% after the company beats EPS estimates by a penny on in-line Q3 revenue, but only offers tepid guidance for Q4 same-store sales and income in a CC.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:59 AM | 1 Comment
